title: Japanese Farmers' Cutting-Edge Techniques for Harvesting Giant Figs | Farming Documentary

tasks.task: Farming and cultivation of fig trees
subtasks: Researching fig tree propagation methods (grafting and cuttings)
Selecting and preparing cuttings for fig trees (length, thickness)
Planting fig tree cuttings in pots or outdoor soil
Providing appropriate fertilizer for fig trees (balancing macro and micro nutrients)
Identifying ideal planting time and location for fig trees (spring/spring or early fall, full sun)
Observing fig tree flowering and fruiting cycles
Harvesting figs at peak ripeness (color, texture, and time)
Mechanisms of fig fruiting (inflorescence, wasp pollination)
Processing of fresh and dried figs (inspection, arranging in trays, transporting to facilities)
Drying techniques for figs (stacking methods, maintaining moisture levels)
Nutrition benefits of fresh and dried figs (Iron, antioxidants, vitamins)
Adapting modern agricultural methods for fig production in Japan
Focusing on maintaining quality and quantity in fig cultivation
Packaging dried figs for retail or wholesale (various types, premium products)
Analyzing the demand for fig products in Southeast Asia (with focus on Malaysia)
